00047   std::string findBaseName(const std::string& s) {
00048     std::string result;
00049 
00050     int n = s.find('.');
00051     result = (n <= 0) ? s : s.substr(0, n);
00052     
00053     return(result);
00054   }

00057   std::string getNextLine(std::istream& is, int *lineno = 0) {
00058     std::string s;
00059     std::string::size_type i;
00060 
00061     for (;;) {
00062       if (getline(is, s, '\n').eof())
00063         break;
00064 
00065       if (lineno != 0)
00066         *lineno += 1;
00067 
00068       // Strip off comments
00069       i = s.find('#');
00070       if (i != std::string::npos)
00071         s.erase(i, s.length() - i);
00072 
00073       // Remove leading whitespace
00074       i = s.find_first_not_of(" \t");
00075       if (i > 0)
00076         s.erase(0, i);
00077 
00078       // Is std::string non-empty?
00079       if (s.length() != 0)
00080         break;
00081     }
00082 
00083     return(s);
00084   }

00088   std::vector<int> readIndexMap(std::istream& is) {
00089     std::vector<int> indices;
00090     int i;
00091     std::string s;
00092 
00093     for (;;) {
00094       s = getNextLine(is);
00095       if (s.length() == 0)
00096         break;
00097 
00098       std::istringstream iss(s);
00099       iss >> i;
00100       indices.push_back(i);
00101     }
00102 
00103     return(indices);
00104   }

00108   std::string invocationHeader(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00109     std::string invoke, user;
00110     int i;
00111   
00112     time_t t = time(0);
00113     std::string timestamp(asctime(localtime(&t)));
00114     timestamp.erase(timestamp.length() - 1, 1);
00115 
00116     struct passwd* pwd = getpwuid(getuid());
00117     if (pwd == 0)
00118       user = "UNKNOWN USER";
00119     else
00120       user = pwd->pw_name;
00121 
00122     invoke = std::string(argv[0]) + " ";
00123     std::string sep(" ");
00124     for (i=1; i<argc; i++) {
00125       if (i == argc-1)
00126         sep = "";
00127       invoke += "'" + std::string(argv[i]) + "'" + sep;
00128     }
00129 
00130     invoke += " - " + user + " (" + timestamp + ")";
00131 
00132 #if defined(REVISION)
00133     invoke += " [" + std::string(REVISION) + "]";
00134 #endif
00135 
00136     // Since some args my be brought in from a file via the shell
00137     // back-tick operator, we process embedded returns...
00138     boost::replace_all(invoke, "\n", "\\n");
00139 
00140     return(invoke);
00141   }

00145   GCoord boxFromRemarks(const Remarks& r) {
00146     int n = r.size();
00147     int i;
00148 
00149     GCoord c(99999.99, 99999.99, 99999.99);
00150 
00151     for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00152       std::string s = r[i];
00153       if (s.substr(0, 6) == " XTAL ") {
00154         std::stringstream is(s.substr(5));
00155         if (!(is >> c.x()))
00156           throw(ParseError("Unable to parse " + s));
00157         if (!(is >> c.y()))
00158           throw(ParseError("Unable to parse " + s));
00159         if (!(is >> c.z()))
00160           throw(ParseError("Unable to parse " + s));
00161 
00162         break;
00163       }
00164     }
00165 
00166     return(c);
00167   }

00171   bool remarksHasBox(const Remarks& r) {
00172     int n = r.size();
00173     for (int i = 0; i<n; i++) {
00174       std::string s = r[i];
00175       if (s.substr(0, 6) == " XTAL ")
00176         return(true);
00177     }
00178     return(false);
00179   }

00190   void randomSeedRNG(void) {
00191     base_generator_type& rng = rng_singleton();

00193     rng.seed(static_cast<unsigned int>(time(0)));

00213   AtomicGroup selectAtoms(const AtomicGroup& source, const std::string selection) {
00214   
00215     Parser parser;
00216 
00217     try {
00218       parser.parse(selection);
00219     }
00220     catch(ParseError e) {
00221       throw(ParseError("Error in parsing '" + selection + "' ... " + e.what()));
00222     }
00223 
00224     KernelSelector selector(parser.kernel());
00225     AtomicGroup subset = source.select(selector);
00226 
00227     if (subset.size() == 0)
00228       throw(NullResult("No atoms were selected using '" + selection + "'"));
00229 
00230     return(subset);
00231   }

00233   std::string timeAsString(const double t) {
00234     if (t < 90.0) {
00235       std::stringstream s;
00236       s << std::fixed << std::setprecision(3) << t << "s";
00237       return(s.str());
00238     }
00239   
00240     double mins = floor(t / 60.0);
00241     double secs = t - mins * 60.0;
00242     if (mins < 90.0) {
00243       std::stringstream s;
00244       s << std::fixed << std::setprecision(0) << mins << "m" << std::setprecision(3) << secs << "s";
00245       return(s.str());
00246     }
00247   
00248     double hrs = floor(mins / 60.0);
00249     mins -= hrs * 60.0;
00250     std::stringstream s;
00251     s << std::fixed << std::setprecision(0) << hrs << "h" << mins << "m" << std::setprecision(3) << secs << "s";
00252     return(s.str());
00253   }

00256   template<>
00257   std::string parseStringAs<std::string>(const std::string& source, const uint pos, const uint nelem) {
00258     std::string val;
00259 
00260     uint n = !nelem ? source.size() - pos : nelem;
00261     if (pos + n > source.size())
00262       return(val);
00263 
00264     for (uint i=pos; i<pos+n; ++i)
00265       if (source[i] != ' ')
00266         val += source[i];
00267 
00268     return(val);
00269   }
00270 
00271   template<>
00272   std::string fixedSizeFormat(const std::string& s, const uint n) {
00273     uint m = s.size();
00274     if (m > n)
00275       return(s.substr(m-n, n));
00276     return(s);
00277   }

00280   namespace {
00281     int pow10[6]={1,10,100,1000,10000,100000};
00282     int pow36[6]={1,36,1296,46656,1679616,60466176};
00283   };
00284 
00285 
00286   
00287   int parseStringAsHybrid36(const std::string& source, const uint pos, const uint nelem) {
00288     uint n = !nelem ? source.size() - pos : nelem;
00289     if (pos + n > source.size())
00290       return(0);
00291 
00292     if (n > 6)
00293       throw(std::logic_error("Requested size exceeds max"));
00294     
00295     std::string s(source.substr(pos, n));
00296     bool negative(false);
00297     std::string::iterator si(s.begin());
00298     n = s.size();
00299 
00300     if (*si == '-') {
00301       negative = true;
00302       ++si;
00303       --n;
00304     }
00305 
00306     // Skip leading whitespace
00307     for (;si != s.end() && *si == ' '; ++si, --n) ;
00308 
00309     int offset = 0;   // This adjusts the range of the result
00310     char cbase = 'a'; // Which set or characters (upper or lower) for the alpha-part
00311     int ibase = 10;   // Number-base (i.e. 10 or 36)
00312 
00313     // Decide which chunk we're in...
00314     if (*si >= 'a') {
00315       offset = pow10[n] + 16*pow36[n-1];
00316       cbase = 'a';
00317       ibase = 36;
00318     } else if (*si >= 'A') {
00319       offset = pow10[n] - 10*pow36[n-1];
00320       cbase = 'A';
00321       ibase = 36;
00322     }
00323 
00324     int result = 0;
00325     while (si != s.end()) {
00326       int c = (*si >= cbase) ? *si-cbase+10 : *si-'0';
00327       result = result * ibase + c;
00328       ++si;
00329     }
00330 
00331     result += offset;
00332 
00333     if (negative)
00334       return(-result);
00335 
00336     return(result);
00337   }
00338

00341   // Note: this currently will overflow if sufficiently negative
00342   // to overflow the base-10 part...
00343   std::string hybrid36AsString(int d, uint n) {
00344 
00345     if (n > 6)
00346       throw(std::logic_error("Requested size exceeds max"));
00347 
00348     int n10 = pow10[n];
00349     int n36 = pow36[n-1];
00350     int cuta = n10 + n36 * 26;  // Cutoff between upper and lower
00351                                 // representations (i.e. A000 vs a000)
00352     bool negative(false);
00353 
00354     if (d < 0) {
00355       negative = true;
00356       d = -d;
00357     }
00358 
00359     if (d >= n10 + 52 * n36)
00360       throw(std::runtime_error("Number out of range"));
00361 
00362     unsigned char coffset = '0';   // Digits offset for output
00363     int ibase = 10;                // Numeric base (i.e. 10 or 36)
00364 
00365     if (d >= cuta) {
00366       coffset = 'a' - 10;
00367       ibase = 36;
00368       d -= cuta;
00369       d += 10*n36;
00370     } else if (d >= n10) {
00371       coffset = 'A' - 10;
00372       d -= n10;
00373       d += 10*n36;
00374       ibase = 36;
00375     }
00376 
00377     std::string result;
00378     while (d > 0) {
00379       unsigned char digit = d % ibase;
00380       digit += (digit > 9) ? coffset : '0';
00381 
00382       result.push_back(digit);
00383       d /= ibase;
00384     }
00385 
00386     if (negative)
00387       result.push_back('-');
00388 
00389     // right-justify...should we be left instead??
00390     for (uint i=result.size(); i < n; ++i)
00391       result.push_back(' ');
00392 
00393     std::reverse(result.begin(), result.end());
00394     return(result);
00395   }
